message.content:
First we need to extract the relevant numbers from the statements. We work with the “End_amount” values (or “Ending Balance”) as given by the date 2024-02-05.

Step 1. Calculate the Current Ratio  
 • Current Assets: The balance sheet gives "Total Current Assets" = 10,022,038.12  
 • Current Liabilities: "Total Current Liabilities" = 967,271.87  
  Current Ratio = Current Assets / Current Liabilities  
  = 10,022,038.12 / 967,271.87 ≈ 10.36

Step 2. Calculate the Quick Ratio  
Quick assets are typically all current assets less the inventory. (You might also sum only cash, bank deposits, receivables etc.)  
 • Inventory = 174,000.00  
 • Quick Assets = Total Current Assets – Inventory  
  = 10,022,038.12 – 174,000.00 = 9,848,038.12  
 • Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Current Liabilities  
  = 9,848,038.12 / 967,271.87 ≈ 10.17

Step 3. Calculate Debt to Asset Ratio  
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets  
In the balance sheet only current liabilities (Accounts Payable + Taxes Payable) are given as liabilities. Hence:  
 • Total Liabilities = 967,271.87  
 • Total Assets = 14,930,535.06  
  Debt to Asset Ratio = 967,271.87 / 14,930,535.06 ≈ 0.0648  
Rounded to two decimal places this is approximately 0.07.

Step 4. Calculate Debt to Equity Ratio  
Debt to Equity Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Owner’s Equity  
 • Total Liabilities = 967,271.87  
 • Owner’s Equity = 13,963,263.19  
  Debt to Equity Ratio = 967,271.87 / 13,963,263.19 ≈ 0.0693  
Rounded, this is approximately 0.07.

Step 5. Calculate Cash Flow to Debt Ratio  
This ratio is defined here as Operating Cash Flow divided by Total Debt (liabilities).  
 • Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = 116,257.19  
 • Total Debt = 967,271.87  
  Cash Flow to Debt Ratio = 116,257.19 / 967,271.87 ≈ 0.1202  
Rounded, about 0.12.

Thus, the answers are:

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Ratio": "10.36",
    "Quick Ratio": "10.17",
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.07",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.07",
    "Cash Flow to Debt Ratio": "0.12"
  }
}
